name: Jean-Baptiste Jean
bio: Jean-Baptiste Jean was born April 21, 1953 in Cap-Haitian and began to paint in 1972 as a student of Philome Obin. (In the first painting below, Jean-Baptiste Jean is seated at an easel with Philome Obin standing next to him, providing guidance.) He also studied at the Centre d'Art in Port-au-Prince, formally joining the Centre in 1973.  He is known as a Third Generation Master of the Northern School.

publications.author: Franciscus, John Allen
publications.title: Haiti: Voodoo Kingdom to Modern Riviera

artworks.title: Visite de Monseignueur Makarios Chez Jn B. Jean
description: Visite de Monseignueur Makarios was one of 25 Haitian paintings from this collection that were exhibited in the show Life in Bold Colors at Sonoma State University, Sonoma, California in 2007.
